dialogues.text: Byron’s like a song with one note. (turns) ‘You ever read a book in your life besides the bible, Byron?

dialogues.speaker: MCELROY
dialogues.text: No need.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (turns to Dan) Byron acts pious, but a couple years back, when he was under contract to the Central, I seen him and some Pinks mow down thirty two Apache, women and children.

dialogues.speaker: MCELROY
dialogues.text: Insurgents was cutting down the railroad men and their families. Picking them one by one off the road. Scalping them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: There was little ones running around crying and screaming. No more than three years old. And his boys shot them all and pushed them in a ditch, some still crying. I guess Byron figured that was fine with Jesus, because apparently Jesus don’t like the Apache. The terrain is getting steeper.

dialogues.speaker: MCELROY
dialogues.text: Keep talking, Wade. All the way to Yuma. Up them steps. To the rope. And straight to hell.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: The day I die, Byron, I’m getting sprung from hell. Riding in the rear, Dan senses there is someone following them. Up front, McElroy looks to Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: MCELROY
dialogues.text: ...I guess maybe I’d feel the same way if I come from the seed of a drunk grave digger and the rancid womb of a whore. McElroy grins. Wade is silent. Eyes dark.

dialogues.speaker: MCELROY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quiet for once. (looking back) What’s wrong, Wade? ‘Cat got your tongue? Afraid of heights?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: No. I’m afraid the Apache on the ridge might shoot me. McElroy whirls around, SHOTGUN raised... ...-BEHIND HIM, WADE LAUNCHES. LEAPING OFF HIS SADDLE. CRASH-TACKLING the Pinkerton with a stunning body-blow. They both fall to the ground. Sliding on the steep rock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan leaps for his rifle but both Doc, frozen, and Butterf fumbling with his pistol, and their spinning horses are i the way. It given Wade the moment he needs-- TO LEVEL MCELROY’S SHOTGUN AT DAN.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drop it, Dan. Drop it! (to Doc and Butterfield) Toss yours down. Wade is fiercely angry, eyes a flame. Dan tosses his rifl down. Doc and Butterfield also comply. Then, Wade turns h a stirring McElroy brutally with the rifle butt. McElroy is delirious as Wade loops his hand-cuffs around boot and drags him to the edge of the ravine. WADE (CONT’D) ...I always liked you, Byron. But you’ve never known when to shut up. He kneels down to the tough old man’s face and pulls him upright. McElroy glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even bad men love their momma. And with that, he shoves McElroy off the edge-- Everyone watches as his body flails, flying downward. Wade turns and points the shotgun at Dan and the others.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. ...Now its time for everyone to go home. But there is a click of a gun, and, all of a sudden, Wade finds himself feeling the barrel of WILLIAM'S OLD PISTOL his ear. It is tightly gripped in William’s two hands.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Don’t move, mister Wade. And let go of that shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: William... Wade grins at William and the quivering pistol. He doesn’ raise his hands. Doesn’t even seem to be concerned. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You’ re not gonna shoot a man you admire in the back of the head, boy. I’m not sure you even know how to work that thing. BANG! The bullet zips past Wade’s ear, takes down a tree branch... ...-Ben Wade’s grin promptly disappears.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dan. Tell your son it’s over. The Pinkerton’s dead. Let’s go our separate ways. You got spread too thin. Its nothing to be ashamed of.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Think you can keep your gun on him, William.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I’m doing a damn sight better than you did. Dan smiles and crosses to his rifle in the dirt. He picks it up, cocks it and aims at Wade. The outlaw sighs, begrudgingly impressed. Butterfield’s pleased. Doc Potter’s relieved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE, WILLIAM, BUTTERFIELD, DAN and DOC POTTER have campe the middle of a massive field of TALL BROWN GRASS which s softly in the night breeze... ...everybody’s hunkered down in a tight circle. Sharing s PIECES OF BREAD and a WATER CANTEEN as they keep a vigila watch through the grass. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wade notices William nervously shuffling his DECK OF CARD

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Your Pa ever take you to some of the towns up north? Breckinridge. Buena Vista. Leadville?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I tell you one thing... They know how to shuffle cards in Leadville.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Stop talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I had the best Irish whiskey I ever tasted there. A dollar a glass. ...There was women in those towns who could do things you’d never forget.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Give you a disease you’d never forget.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: With money in your pocket you could have whatever a man desired or needed. I learned everything I know there. Landed there no older than you. On my own. And I left with the start of my gang. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e OF +e eH OF  3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A wistful smile washes over the outlaw’s face.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Course, its all gone now. Silver crashed, and then the railroad changed everything.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: For the better I am sure. The awed look in William’s eyes is killing Dan... ..Clearly, he doesn’t talk with William like this.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: ...How many men you think you’ve killed since you set out with your gang, Wade? How many families you think you destroyed. Hundreds?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Quite a few. I’m a bad man, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DOC POTTER
dialogues.text: I heard you dynamited a wagon full of prospectors last Spring.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Now that’s a lie... (to William) ...it was a train full. William smiles... ...and Dan is crushed.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to go, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: You ain’t going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) No. I mean I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan escorts Wade through the TALL GRASS a short way from camp. The SHOTGUN in his hands, alert for threats. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’d appreciate it if you wouldn’t fill his head with stories of death and sin.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: No use hiding the world, Dan. He’s trying to decide which way to go.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He’1l decide better without more from you.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I thought he was gonna shoot me on that ravine. There’s wild in his eyes. Reminds me of--

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: He’s nothing like you.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: The road to corruption is steep and slippery, Dan.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: The path of decency is just as steep. Wade steps away and turns his back to Dan, pissing

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: That’s true, Dan. It is. You do one good deed and feel all decent. (MORE)
(CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WADE (cont'd) I imagine it’s habit forming. Soon, you’re a slave to your decency. You’ re not a man no more. You don’t ever do what you want. Take what you want. You don’t know what you want. You just keep being decent and good till your hollow and dead. Dan’s disturbed by Wade’s words... ...-he gazes through the TALL GRASS back at his son. When Dan turns back around... ...Wade has disappeared. Dan’s horrified. Rushing through the grass. Suddenly, WaDE LEAPS OUT OF THE GRASS AND GRABS DAN, wres him to the ground. Dan manages to lift his SHOTGUN into Wade’s face... Wade is shushing him. Looking up to the rocks. Sensing something out there. BANG! The GUNSHOT comes from nowhere... ...and knocks Dan flat on his back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- they hear the shot at the camp. William suddenly runs into the grass with his old PISTOL. The others trying in to stop him -- tee FH HOF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- more BULLETS fly over Wade’s head as William drops dow beside him, checking on his father. Dan’s wounded. The sh clipped his skull... ...no time to think, Wade and William grab Dan and begin drag him back towards the campsite. GUNSHOTS ripping thro the grass on all sides. Wade catches glimpses of them in the brush. A flash of BA FEATHERS. A swish of RAWHIDE TROUSERS. A glint of a TOMAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses are freaking out. BULLETS whizzing past their as Butterfield and Doc Potter help pull Dan into their ca Dan’s starting to regain his bearings, looking about... ...the GUNFIRE is coming from three sides. They can’t see shooters through the grass. But the GUNFIRE is volcanic. keeps his head low, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: There’s three of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yours.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: If they were mine, you’d be dead. Dan struggles to cock his SHOTGUN, woozy... ...the blood seeping into his eyes and blinding him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give me a gun.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You want them to scalp your boy. Dan stares at the outlaw, the GUNFIRE drawing closer... ...the others watch from their firing positions, waiting see what Dan’s going to do. Finally, he gives Wade the HA SHOTGUN... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...the outlaw checks the TWO SHELLS inside. Then holds ou his hand for more shells. Dan shakes his head, grimacing pain as Doc Potter tries to staunch the bleeding. Wade realizes he’s not getting any more ammo. He scoffs a Dan, then cocks both barrels of the shotgun. Waiting for pause in the SHOOTING... ...then he scrambles away and vanishes into the grass. Th others keep their eyes on the TALL GRASS. Praying. Hoping BOOM! They hear the SHOTGUN roar... ...no more shooting from the left of them. William dares to lift his head. Glancing around at the TA GRASS. Heart in his throat. Waiting. Watching. Lying stil BOOM! Another SHOTGUN BLAST out there... ...no more shooting from the right of them now. Dan keeps his eyes on the RIFLE SHOTS from ahead... ...and then all of a sudden, the rifle stops shooting. Everyone in the camp listens now to the SOUNDS OF A STRUG somewhere out in the grass. Men GRAPPLING and WRESTLING w each other... ...there’s an ABRUPT GASP. The sound of METAL SLICING FLE and the fall of a body to the ground. Then there’s silenc Everybody stares into the swaying TALL GRASS... ...and then, a FIGURE appears. Walking towards them. It’s Ben Wade. Covered in the blood of others. Looking li death incarnate and furious for having been made to kill Apache warriors... ...but most alarming is the fact that Wade now has one of feathered APACHE RIFLES in his MANACLED HANDS. The other are slung over his shoulder. Butterfield reaches for his rifle... ...-but a look from Wade makes his freeze. Now he aims at Dan like he’s going to kill him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you not to go this way. I told you there’d be trouble.

dialogues.speaker: DOC POTTER
dialogues.text: It was Mister McElroy’s decision. Wade glances aside at Doc Potter... ...then returns his bitter gaze on Dan.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Give me the key. Dan digs the HAND-CUFFS KEY out of his pocket... ...then hurls it out into the field of tall grass. Everybody watches the key sail through the air, swallowed first by the darkness, then by the endless field of grass ...and Wade just can’t believe it. He zeroes in on Dan. L his rifle. And ruthlessly wallops Dan across the jaw with rifle butt. AND DAN BLACKS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN COMES TO SEVERAL MINUTES LATER. Doc Potter sits him u with William’s help. Butterfield hovers anxiously behind.

dialogues.speaker: DOC POTTER
dialogues.text: Easy does it. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (weak) Where is he.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: He’s gone. Took our horses with him. I found this in the grass. ...it’s the HAMMER SHOTGUN. Taking the gun as he pushes himself to his feet. He’s wobbly, but otherwise fine.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: He went that way.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It’s the fastest way out of the pass. He’1l be looking for help getting those cuffs off. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DAN (cont'd) (to William) Find his tracks, son.

dialogues.speaker: DOC POTTER
dialogues.text: We’re going after him.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: There’s no reward for getting him halfway to that train, is there?

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: No, sir. Doc Potter considers this as Dan loads his SHOTGUN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON-- BEN WADE as he cautiously approaches a freshly railroad tunnel. BOOM! A LOW RUMBLING EXPLOSION rocks the mountain range and shakes the ground (and vibrates camera Something big is happening on the other side of the tunne OVER BEN as he emerges from the tunnel to see-- DOZENS OF CHINESE WORKERS moving about, laying track. Ten line the graded earth, sprinkled with woks and bowls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A labyrinth of squalid housing. The workers themselves ar thin and beat to hell. They wear umbrella-like hats to wa off the SCORCHING SUN. A cloud from the recent explosion billows in the distance Wade rides cautiously through the camp. He betrays no emotion, perhaps he has none... ...he’s on a mission, his eyes scanning the workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: WALTER BOLES (48) sucking a cigar at his desk a feeds leftover SCRAMBLED EGGS to a PET MONKEY on a leash. ...a Ssleepy-eyed PROSTITUTE lays on a couch behind him a head of the train car. The windows have all been curtaine bookish TELEGRAPH OPERATOR mans the TELEGRAPH CONSOLE nea Three RAILROAD ENFORCERS sit about, including ZEKE (44) w meticulously filing his nails. A BULLWHIP dangles on his Boles feeds his PET MONKEY as Zeke speaks long-sufferingl

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Says they want forty dollars each month now. Like them Irish up north. Goddamn Coolies. They’1l work fine with my left boot up their asses.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: If I could teach a monkey to lay track...

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What we need’s some Negroes brung in here, Mister Boles. Show these Chinamen what real work is. Just now, Boles sees -- Wade riding outside... ...sifting through the DUSTY HAZE like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: Holy Christ...

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What. What is it.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: (pause) That’s him.  98 99 3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TENT FLAP abruptly peels back to reveal Wade in the ope of a CHINESE FAMILY’s tent. A APACHE RIFLE in his hands.. ...there are several people inside. A MATRIARCH. Three YO DAUGHTERS. And a GRANDMOTHER. All of them go still when W enters their tent. Wade scans the tent for threats, noticing a HAMMER and CH lying on a stool. He closes the TENT FLAP and advances on frightened family... ...pointing to his HAND-CUFFS and the HAMMER and CHISEL.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You. Break the hand-cuffs. You help me. With the hammer. Without warning, a VOLLEY OF GUNFIRE rips into the small from every direction. Dishes explode and splinters fly... ...the CHINESE FAMILY hits the dirt with Wade. The MATRIA pinning her screaming daughters to the ground. Wade glances at the CHINESE FAMILY who seem unhurt, but terrified, the children screaming in Chinese. BOLES O.S. I got five guns on you out here, Ben Wade. You best come on out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan leads our dwindling group through the first tunnel an into the blasting camp, staring at the conditions of the CHINESE WORKERS. ...we notice William caught by the haunted eyes of a teen CHINESE WORKER hauling a basket full of rocks past the gr

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: The horses. He’s pointing at the TRAIN CAR where their horses are hit to a post. THEY HEAR A MAN SCREAM INSIDE... ...the train car is perched on some rails in the middle o the camp. Two TELEGRAPH WIRES connect the car to a chain TELEGRAPH POLES.  100 3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: WADE as Zeke SHOCKS his BARE TORSO with an EXPO WIRE that extends from A BLASTING BOX... ...the two other RAILROAD ENFORCERS gather around with Bo and the TELEGRAPH OPERATOR. The PROSTITUTE is in the wind

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here. The two RAILROAD ENFORCERS whirl around with their guns.. ...and our group stops instantly. Dan lowers his SHOTGUN. glances at Wade. And the exhausted outlaw just smiles bac

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: Mister Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Mister Boles.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: All finished in Bisbee. (no reply) Better hurry. We making the last blasts through the mountain this week, Butterfield nods, tense. Boles waltzes over to him now... ...the two men face to face, which unsettles Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what’re you doing in my neck of the woods, Mister Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: That’s our prisoner. We’re taking him to Contention. Putting him on the prison train to Yuma.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: What prisoner. I don’t see anybody that’s a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Come now, Mister Boles. That’s Ben Wade you have there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: Ben Wade gunned down my kid brother in front of me. Six years ago in Abilene.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Your brother was a lying, bilking card sharp. That is, if he’s the asshole I remember. He could, of course, have been another asshole I killed who I forgot about. Boles flushes red, glancing at Zeke... ...who SHOCKS Wade again. Wade just glares at Zeke, buryi the pain. And there’s a sudden pang of fear in Zeke’s eye He stops and Wade finally slumps, held up only by his HAN CUFFS which are looped over a hook attached to the train. Dan glances aside at William.. ...wishing he didn’t have to see that.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: You can’t do this. It’s immoral.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Morals got nothing to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (pause) I was expecting to collect two hundred dollars reward for that man.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: That’s too bad, rancher.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: No. Its not. I have to deliver him to Contention. I need that money.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: You need it bad enough to die. Dan feels the RAILROAD ENFORCER’s guns on him... ...he st at Wade, then finally relents.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: At least, let us have our horses. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: I’ve got no problem with that. So long as you ride away. (pause) Ride away, rancher.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Nice knowing you, Dan. Dan locks eyes with Wade as the others retrieve their hor and ride back up to Dan. Boles doesn’t move, watching Dan ...a last look at Wade and Dan turns to his horse. Nobody notices Doc Potter pulling a SHOVEL out of a pile rocks. He hefts the tool and swings it with all his might ...WHACK! Straight into a RAILROAD ENFORCER’s face. The man tumbles backwards, cradling his BLOODY NOSE. Dan seizes the moment, spinning around. Catching Boles in stomach with a powerful right-hand punch. Boles doubles o gaping for air... ...it’s all happening so quick, William doesn’t know what going on. He glimpses Wade using his HAND-CUFFS to lift h legs and kick Zeke in the chest. The TELEGRAPH OPERATOR drops his pistol and runs... ...while the other RAILROAD ENFORCER fires a shot at Dan. shot misses. Dan quickly lays a right hook across Boles’ William spurs his horse forward at the RAILROAD ENFORCER. ...who ducks aside just in time. Butterfield rides up to with his black horse and the outlaw clambers aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan takes the lead as the group races through the busy ca heading for the tunnel. CHINESE WORKERS jump aside, clear a path for them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...meanwhile, Boles and Zeke and the two RAILROAD ENFORCE regroup fast. Leaping onto their horses and giving chase.  103 104 105 3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like mice navigating a maze, the two groups weave through endless rows of tents. BOLES’ GROUP shooting at DAN’S GRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHINESE WORKERS stream in and out of the tunnel, moving r in WHEELBARROWS. Some leading PACK MULES with sacks strap across their backs... ...they scramble out of the way as Dan and his group barr past into the tunnel. Boles and the RAILROAD ENFORCERS ar close behind, GUNS BLAZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHINESE WORKERS jump to the sides of the tunnel for safet ...the GUNSHOTS echoing like cannon blasts within the nar walls. Oddly, Doc Potter’s got a Cheshire grin on his fac

dialogues.speaker: DOC POTTER
dialogues.text: You see me get that one with the shovel. But before Dan can reply, Doc Potter gasps with pain... ...a BULLET striking him between the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Doc. He begins to fall off his horse... ...-but William grabs him, keeping him on. They emerge from one tunnel and enter another as-- BOLES closes in from one hundred feet behind, lining up f another shot as he rides. Zeke and the other two are only length behind Boles. ANGLE ON: WADE spotting A CRATE OF TNT lying before the n tunnel. Hanging low off his horse, WADE SCOOPS A BUNDLE O DYNAMITE --AND TURNS TO DAN.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: If I throw this, can you shoot it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan’s answer is cock his rifle. He pulls up his horse to William, Butterfield and Doc rip past. Wade also pulls up heaving the TNT bundle toward--

dialogues.speaker: A SUPPORT SCAFFOLD ABOVE--
dialogues.text: BANG! Dan fires! And they ride like hell as-- KABOOM! IT BLOWS. Dan and Wade spur their horses and just escape the fiery breath of the explosion and the BOULDERS that fall from above. The tunnel caves in behind them... ...cutting off Boles and his group who’s horses buck from explosion. Boles is singed from the fire and livid, glari at the impasse.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: Goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and his group ride out the other end of the tunnel. W collapses on his horse, the effects of his torture catchi up with him now... ...before he knows it, Dan snatches the HAMMER SHOTGUN ba and loads a pair of shells. He gives it to Butterfield. A helps William ease Doc Potter out of his saddle. They lay under the shade of a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: DOC POTTER
dialogues.text: (fading) Did we do it. Did we get away.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Doc... Thanks to you. Doc Potter smiles, then his body goes limp... ...and Dan just stares at him. Wade watches this. William’s eyes follow -- The half-built tracks that threa into the valley and finally to THE SPRAWLING LOW CITY OF CONTENTION TEN MILES OFF. Dan’s eyes are heavy. The last forty-eight hours are star to take their toll. Wade studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Boles and the others exit their end of the tun Limping back into the camp. Boles barks orders about gett their horse to the other side. As they emerge from the tunnel, Boles suddenly stops talking. WHAT THEY SEE: Charlie Prince and the other outlaws. Perc upon their exhausted, sweat-stained horses, they circle through the camp and come to a stop at the entrance to th tunnel... ...they look exhausted, been riding all night.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: ...Who are you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: We’re looking for a group escorting an outlaw by the name of Ben Wade.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: ...Shit, they just passed through here.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: That so.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: We were chasing them through the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: We’re going after them, ‘you want to join us.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: What’s it to you.

dialogues.speaker: BOLES
dialogues.text: Ben Wade shot my brother. In Abilene. Six years ago.

dialogues.speaker: SUTHERLAND
dialogues.text: Then your brother must be famous. This draws some smiles on the outlaws...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: You boys some kind of posse, huh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOLES

dialogues.text: ...and Dan lines up on it. But it’s just an OLD MAN peeki out. He quickly closes the door. Dan and Wade keep moving

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel lobby is deserted, a contrast to the way we fir saw it. Only the BARTENDER’s still here... ...-he watches Dan come down the stairs with Wade. He tak out a BOTTLE OF WHISKEY and pours two shots on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (to Dan) On the house, mister. Dan stares at the drinks, then leads Wade to the bar... Dan and Wade drink the shots. Dan thanks the BARTENDER wi look, then presses on. The BARTENDER watches them go. ANGLE ON: DAN & WADE reaching the BACK DOOR they came thr before. Dan trades a look with Wade as he clutches the BA DOOR HANDLE.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: There’s still time to get out of this. Dan looks at the outlaw, a thousand thoughts racing throu his head. Then he cocks the SHOTGUN. And turns the handle The BACK DOOR swings open... and a BLAST OF WIND rushes i Dan grasps Wade by the BACK OF HIS COLLAR, laying the bar of the SHOTGUN over Wade’s shoulder as they creep outside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outlaw scans the ROOFTOPS and ALLEYWAYS as Dan pushes out the door. Both men quickly realize their horses are g

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Didn’t expect them to let us ride to the station, did you. All of a sudden, Campos appears on a rooftop... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ...and Dan hurls Wade behind a STACK OF CRATES as the out shoots his rifle. BANG! The round misses Dan by inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campos keeps his rifle trained on the STACK OF CRATES as swiftly cocks the LEVER ACTION, chambering a new round as DOWN BELOW-- Dan and Wade scurry toward the end of the al heading for cover under an overhang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --BANG-- Campos fires again. Dirt sprays up at Dan as he shoves Wade below the overhang. ...under the deck, Dan tries to get a look at Campos. He scans the roofline, considering his options. Dan turns and follows Wade’s glance to a large bullet hol the top of his boot. If Dan had a foot, his toes would ha been blown off. He looks up at Wade. Almost laughs. Wade nods as a LOCAL GUNMAN lunges from a corner...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: -uh ...behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the Gunman.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Figure I owed you one for getting me out of that camp.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Now you’re on your own. ...And only five blocks to go. It’s a wide street, no cover. Not good. The depot far in distance. A clock at the General Store reads Four past th Dan studies the roofline... Tries to get a fix on Campos.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Where’s the rest of them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: ...waiting.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Tell your rifleman, he shoots at me again, I’1l just put a bullet in your head.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: And what do I tell them? FOUR LOCAL GUNMEN are coming up the wide street that lead the station. Two of them are shit-faced drunk, SHOOTING i the air, one hooting... Dan’s eyes find another, pistol trained on them from across the street. ...and then they begin FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOTEL ROOM / STAIRS-- DAY
dialogues.text: Butterfield and William stand frozen, listening to the sh RING OUT. Unable to stand anymore, William suddenly makes run for it.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: Son! Stop! William races down the hall with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE STREET-- CHARLIE PRINCE--
dialogues.text: --watches the gunfire with satisfaction. He glances to Jackson. Sutherland watches from behind.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: ‘Might not ever have to touch your Scofields, Charlie...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: That’d be disappointing. Charlie’s grin fade as--

dialogues.speaker: --THE FUSILLADE BECOMES FURIOUS, INSANE. BULLETS SHATTER
dialogues.text: BARRELS and roof around DAN AND WADE. The gunmen fire indiscriminately and Wade seems as likely to get shot as (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: ...What happens if they shoot the boss, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: 162B BACK ON-- DAN AND WADE-- UNDER THE OVERHANG
dialogues.text: AS A WOOD POST BY WADE’S HEAD EXPLODES WITH SHELLFIRE. Cursing, WADE DIVES FOR COVER WITH DAN.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: ...This is bullshit. UP THE STREET-- CHARLIE PRINCE REACTS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: Hey! ...Hey! Not the black hat! Red faced, CHARLIE CHARGES AT THE GUNMEN, firing. CHARLIE PRINCE (CONT’D) I said the rancher, you dumb-shits! CAMPOS HAS FOUND A NEW VANTAGE POINT ON THE ROOFTOP. He starts picking off the locals. As does Sutherland from another vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Let’s go. Now. WADE’S ENTIRE GANG IS FIRING ON THE LOCAL GUNMEN. It looks and sounds like war. Dan seizes the moment, grabs Wade and breaks into a sprin across the wide street. They run through the hail of gunf DAN HITS JACKSON WITH A SHOT, shoves Wade in the door of-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter, a shot clips Wade in the shoulder, knockin him back. Dan spins, firing at-- A LOCAL GUNMAN who drops. Lungs clutching for air, Dan glances out the door behind them, shots still reporting from the street. Dan drags Wade toward the back of the store and goes abou reloading his guns. Suddenly-- --POW! WADE HITS HIM in the face with cuffed fists and sh him against a wall, each with their hands on the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: That’s enough, Dan. Its over.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We’ re going to the train.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: No. We’re not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DAN STRUGGGLES to regain control of the gun. As they thra A SHELF SPILLS. Suddenly, A LANTERN NEAR DAN’S HEAD EXPLO FROM GUNFIRE. From the store window, Jorgenson and Kinter try to pick o Dan. Dan shoves Wade back and spins, taking a shot-- kill Jorgenson and sending the rest for cover

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: We’re going to the train, Wade. As Dan grabs at Wade, trying to drag him further, Wade ju stands there, unmoving. Dan pulls at him, as more shots r Suddenly, Wade kicks out DAn’s good leg, sending him down steps into A STOCKROOM-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Your boy’s gone home. No one’s watching. You were a hero once. You got one good leg to show for it. Use it to get home. Wade turns his back on Dan and faces the door outside-- Shots still ring out. Suddenly, stockroom Wade ends

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Charlie-- Hold up. ...Charlie! We’ re comin’ out. Dan grabs Wade around the neck and pulls him to the floor. They roll, punching at each other. Hard. up with his cuff chain around Dan’s neck, pining him. Dan looks up at him-- intense.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: ...I never been no hero. Only battle I ever saw, my company was in retreat. We was running through the woods under fire from our own side. By the time I got to the river, everyone else had fallen... and my foot was gone... and still don’t know how. All I know is I lost it running, scared and blind and in retreat. You try telling that story to your little boy, Wade. And you watch his eyes. Wade takes this in. The chain loosens around Dan’s neck. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I am not afraid to die. Not no more. Only thing scares me now is running away.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: ...Okay, Dan. Out the cracked stock room door, DAN SPIES A ROOF WORKER’ LADDER. +e OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF HF HH HH HF *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e OF  3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 101A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan pulls Wade across the CITY ROOFTOPS dodging WILD GUNF from below. Dan stops before jumping over a narrow alleyw

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You sure you can take it. Dan jumps pulling Wade with him. The impact sends a spasm pain through his bad leg. They jump a second alleyway. Dan is in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Charlie Prince and the others chase them on the gro shooting at silhouettes. Attempting to outrun them to the of the chain of buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! BANG! BANG! Splinters fly as Dan and Wade rush towa the last rooftop now. Both of them leaping off the edge..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and CRASHING through a CANVAS AWNING which lands them on a FOOD STALL. Dan quickly draws his WINCHESTER on Wade ...the two men finally catching their breath together now

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Worked alright, didn’t it.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Yeah... Worked real good. Wade grabs an APPLE from the food stall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Wade run in tandem through the CANVAS TENTS in wh the railroad workers live. In a spray of gunfire, they mo from blazing light to dark. Bullets make silent holes in dark canvas. BANG! BANG! BANG! The shots come at him from all sides... ...several of shots clip Dan’s arms and legs. One of them even blows his hat right off his head. Dan shoves Wade forwards -- both of them hobbling now. Ten yards to go. Three more tents. The outlaws charge after them. Just five yards now. A HAIL OF GUNFIRE chasing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan yanks open the door to the ticket booth. All but thro Wade inside. Bullets CRACK and SPLINTER off the wooden bo as Dan dives inside... ...the TICKET CLERK crouches in the corner. Staring at th two men. Dan is weak, bleeding from several wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, Charlie Prince and the others gather quietly aro the booth. Twenty feet away. No chance of escaping this o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan keeps his gun on Wade as he looks at the TICKET CLERK

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: What...what time is it.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET CLERK
dialogues.text: About ten past three.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Where’s the 3:10 to Yuma.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET CLERK
dialogues.text: Running late, I suppose. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: How late.

dialogues.speaker: TICKER CLERK
dialogues.text: Beats me... It gets here when it gets here, don’t it. Dan stares at the man blankly... ...and Wade just breaks into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Goddamn trains. Never can depend of them, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William barges into the Bridal Suite to find it’s empty. a wafer-thin PIECE OF PAPER torn out of the HOTEL BIBLE l on the rocker... ...-he picks up the paper and we see a SKETCH of Dan sitt on the rocker with his SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the booth, Dan winces with the pain rippling throu his body. He has GUNSHOT WOUNDS in his arms and legs. Blo also trickles from a head wound... ...Wade takes a KERCHIEF out of his pocket and begins to a TOURNIQUET around Dan’s leg.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You stupid sonofabitch. I’ve given you every opportunity to get out of this and now look at you. Wade finishes tying the TOURNIQUET... ...and Dan just gazes at him gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I ain’t stubborn... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (confused) What.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: At the camp, you said I was stubborn for... For keeping my family on that ranch...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Yeah well, what else you call it.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: It’s my son... Mark... The younger one. Got tuberculosis when we was two... Doctors said he’d die if he... He didn’t have a dry climate.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What’re you telling me this for.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Guess I wanted you to know I’m not stubborn is all ...Ben. Wade stares at Dan’s grin, and starts to smile himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, the whole towns seems to be lying in wait. Charl Prince is the closest to the TICKET BOOTH, trying to see ANGLE ON: WILLIAM riding up behind the outlaws, joining a CROWD OF PEOPLE venturing out to witness the showdown... Butterfield rides up beside William. It’s clear to all wh Dan and Wade are. Jorgensen rides up, towing WADE’S BLACK MARE behind him as William quickly peels his horse away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Dan and Wade in the ticket booth...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Long as we’re making confessions.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I’ve been to Yuma Prison before. twice before. Escaped twice, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, William rides to the CATTLE YARD next to the station. He dismounts, keeping hidden... ...as he makes his way through the CATTLE towards the gat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade stares at Dan in the ticket booth...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: There’s no sense putting me on this train, Dan. I’11 be out within the week, ...and Dan just stares at him, wounded, fading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now William quietly slips the CATTLE GATE open, then scut back to his horse. The CATTLE stay in their yard, confuse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Wade makes his final plea to Dan:

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You made it further than anybody ever expected. Most of all, me. You did it. Go on home to your family. Dan looks at him. Suddenly, they hear a TRAIN WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here she comes, the 3:10 to Yuma. A STEAM-POWERED LOCOMOT hauling seven TRAIN CARRIAGES and a JAILHOUSE CABOOSE... ...all heads turn to watch as she puffs towards the stati  188 189 190 191 3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and Wade peer over the TICKET COUNTER and see the tra coming towards them. And Dan just starts checking his amm gearing up for the last few yards.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Do me a favor, will you... When you break out of Yuma, don’t go back to your crew.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: Hang up your guns, settle down somewhere. Raise a family... (pause) ...that’s what you want, isn’t it.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What the hell do you know about what I want. Dan finishes RELOADING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Prince keeps his SCHOFIELDS on the ticket booth a the train nears the station.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: (to the gang) They’1l be coming. ...the other outlaws now prepare for the final shoot-out. crowd, including Butterfield, watching anxiously behind t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William gets ready on his horse at the back of the CATTLE the LOCOMOTIVE rolls past, HISSING STEAM out its wheels..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...pulling into the station as the DOOR OPENS on the tick booth. Dan escorts Wade out, the HAMMER SHOTGUN at his ba (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The OUTLAWS and the CONTENTION GUNMEN get set to fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but then William suddenly fires a shot from his old PI and the spooked CATTLE begin to stampede out the open gat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan sees his son deftly whipping up the cattle... ...and for a moment, Dan’s furious. But then he realizes William’s driving the CATTLE between them and the outlaws The animals steam past the outlaws, blocking their line o fire. Charlie Prince falls beneath them, engulfed in PLUM OF STEAM from the LOCOMOTIVE... ...we hear him SCREAM as the cattle trample him. Dan and Wade break for the JAILHOUSE CABOOSE at the back the train. Keeping their heads low just beyond the CATTLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old PRISON GUARD on the JAILHOUSE CABOOSE sees Dan com with Wade. He rises to his feet, grabbing the JAILHOUSE K off the rack behind him..

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: I’ve got a prisoner to go to Yuma. Wade looks at Dan who appears shocked to have made it her To have been able to say those eight words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody can see anything through the large HERD OF CATTLE. even WADE’S GANG who are effectively cut off from their b  196 197 198 199 200 3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile spreads across Dan’s weary face. Wade smiles, too Genuinely happy for him. BANG! A GUNSHOT echoes through the train station.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: No. Dan SCREAMS with pain, returning fire... ...it’s Charlie Prince. Materializing out of the steam. B up from the CATTLE STAMPEDE. Dan’s SHOTGUN clips his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody hears the shots. Peering through the rain and s from the locomotive. The outlaws pushing through the catt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! BANG! BANG! Charlie Prince cuts Dan down... ...ripping into his legs, his arms, his chest. The HAMMER SHOTGUN falls to the soggy ground. His body spun around. Wade leaps off the JAILHOUSE CABOOSE, flinging himself in the line of fire. Charlie Prince stops firing just in tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: WILLIAM seeing his father fall as the cattle pa fifty feet away. A river of shock grips him like a vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON: WADE helpless to save Dan who collapses into th mud, a look of shock on his face. Wade grinds to a halt n to him... ...kneeling beside him, cradling the dying rancher’s head his lap. Charlie Prince triumphantly reloads his SCHOFIEL

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Dan. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dan looks up at Wade, bloody and weak... ...a faint grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stricken, William stares at his father, twenty yards off, Wade’s arms, frozen. Butterfield approaches from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other outlaws walk up now, holstering their weapons a fetching horses. Gathering around Wade in a loose circle. ...as Charlie Prince struts over and grabs a CUFFS KEY fr the PRISON GUARD. He UNLOCKS Wade now, dropping the key a the cuffs as he walks off. Charlie Prince spits at Dan’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE PRINCE
dialogues.text: (laughing) For a one leg rancher, you was one tough sonovabitch. Wade gently sets Dan down. His gaze falls on the HAMMER SHOTGUN lying nearby... his eyes go stone fucking cold. CLOSE ON: CHARLIE PRINCE who has taken only a few steps, he stops. An alarming sixth sense telling him to turn aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William tries to run to his father, tears in his eyes, bu Butterfield grabs hold of him... pulls him under an overh they are both getting wet.

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: You need to stay here, son. William kicks and claws at Butterfield.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Let go of me! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUTTERFIELD
dialogues.text: You can’t help him right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the outlaws have gone rock still in the rain. All eyes Wade and the SHOTGUN. Wade is just as still and silent. Suddenly, Charlie Prince draws... ...BOOM! The HAMMER SHOTGUN bellows. Catapulting Charlie back three feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shot rings out, William turns-- becomes still. Everybody’s stunned and riveted.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: He shot one of his own men... He just shot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade’s gang is shocked... ...and livid. Staring at Charli Prince lying on the ground. What happens next takes no mo than twenty seconds. Jackson draws his rifle on Wade... ...BANG! The shot scrapes Wade’s shoulder. And Wade lifts the HAMMER SHOTGUN and fires. Jackson vani in a CLOUD OF SMOKE. And Wade tosses the empty shotgun as Sutherland and Jorgensen draw their guns now... ...as Wade dives and rolls towards Charlie Prince. Snatching the two SCHOFIELD PISTOLS from his hands. The p of outlaws shoot at Wade as he comes up out of his roll a blasts them both away. Now Campos draws. And BANG-- Wade takes him out with ruth precision. Campos unloads his weapon as he falls backward One shot clips Wade in the arm.  207 208 209 3:10 TO YUMA - TAN - 1.23.07 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William watches Wade twenty yards away through the rain.. .»..a dark, silhouetted outlaw brandishing DOUBLE PISTOLS is terrifying. A mad-dog killer. Face twisted with pain. William walks toward the gunfire. When Butterfield lunges him, but William knocks Butterfield back with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade spins around on the last outlaw now... It’s Nez. Lin up on his boss. He hesitates when their eyes meet. And in that moment, Wade fires. Nez takes a blast to the chest but stays upright. He look Wade, sad. Wade shoots him again. And again. This is not for Wade. Finally, Nez topples. Wade turns, eyes filled with emotion, noticing-- A mortally wounded Charlie Prince, pulling a pistol from Jorgensen’s holster. BAM, BAM, BAM-- Wade unloads his gun, putting an end to i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William arrives at his father’s side, clutching his OLD PISTOL. He takes his father’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You done it, Pa. You done it. You put him on the train. Dan smiles weakly, looks his son in the eye, and releases last breath. William looks up. As the SMOKE clears, Wade stands amidst a pile of bodies the train. Bloody and beat. Wade looks at William. William points his PISTOL on the outlaw... ...and Wade just stands there. He even drops the SCHOFIELDS. Surrendering to his fate. William can shoot Wade if he wants... but he glances to h father. He tosses the gun and kneels beside him. CLOSE ON: WILLIAM glaring at Wade. Intense. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: WADE. Through the pain and the blood, he turns limps to the JAILHOUSE CABOOSE. BUTTERFIELD comes forward with A TOWN PHYSICIAN. The doctor tends to Dan, but there is nothing to be done. William watches as-- Wade climbs up, putting himself on the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Wade limps into the barred JAILHOUSE CABOOSE. The old PRISON GUARD goes to cuff him, but Wade gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade settles inside the caboose on a bench opposite two THIEVES. They’re both handcuffed, gazing at him in awe... Wade hardly notices. His thoughts elsewhere. We see a fli of emotion cross his weary face. The GUARD locks the door Gives a wave to the TRAIN DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STEAM WHISTLE blows and the iron wheels begin to turn ...and now we hear Wade give a WHISTLE from inside. CLOSE ON-- BUTTERFIELD as he notices-- WADE’S BLACK HORSE REACTING TO THE WHISTLE. The horse tro after the train, past William, and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands there. Watching the train disappear. Forever changed.
